results.title: 21 Up (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Margaret Bottomley, Michael Apted and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
In 1964 a number of seven year olds expressed their views on life, leisure, love, marriage, colour prejudice, education and money (SEVEN UP). At fourteen years of age they commented on their changing views (7 PLUS SEVEN). Now at twenty-one, using clips from these films, the program compares the responses of this group of individuals as they grow to adulthood. This film is recommended for Years 11-12 and Tertiary level education.

results.title: People without a land
results.creator_credit: Stephen Segaller and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at Israel’s apparent campaign to take over Palestine, not with arms but by building huge settlements all over the occupied West Bank and offering accommodation at heavily subsidised prices to Jewish settlers. Allegations are made that Israel plans to drive Arabs out of occupied territories. Includes interviews with Palestinian farmers who have lost some of their land, Israeli Ministers and neutral commentators.

results.title: The Peace War
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The Peace War looks at the growing power of peace movements in Europe and the propaganda victories won by the proponents of nuclear disarmament. Examines the arguments for and against the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament in Britain.

results.title: On the trail of the torturers
results.creator_credit: Michael Ryan and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
As Greece prepares for its first democratic election in a decade, “World in Action” focuses on the torturers who were recruited by the former dictatorship to “discourage” opposition. This is a powerful and confronting documentary containing graphic accounts by both the torturers and the victims of torture.

Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: Mother's little helpers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines the problem of depressed housewives who are becoming addicted to drugs, particularly tranquilizers prescribed by their doctors to help them cope with life.

results.title: Mongolia. Ep. 2. The City on the Steppes
results.creator_credit: Brian Moser, Mongolian Television and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The Mongolian People’s Republic which began with the Revolution of 1921, was once domoinated by nomadic herdsmen but today is becoming a self-sufficient, agricultural and industrial nation. Of the one and a half million people, about a quarter live in the capital city of Ulan Bator. Anthropologist Owen Lattimre looks at life in Ulan Bator including cultural activities, horse racing and schooling. Highlights the recognition of women at work, production and education.

Anthropologist Owen Lattimre looks at life in Ulan Bator including cultural activities, horse racing and schooling. Highlights the recognition of women at work, production and education.

results.title: The Miami experiment
results.creator_credit: Brian Blake and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
An American defence lawyer argues that his 15 year-old client is not guilty of murder. The plea is insanity, caused by exposure to television violence. The trial is the first major trial to be televised live during the proceedings. The case for and against this radical experiment is examined. A landmark use of television cameras inside a courtroom…an interesting overview and outcome from 1976. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description:

A landmark use of television cameras inside a courtroom…an interesting overview and outcome from 1976. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Man who stole Uganda
results.creator_credit: John Sheppard and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Uganda’s General Milton Obote was deposed by his own army. It took Major General Idi Amin, self-appointed Head of Army and State, just one week to take charge of key services and installations. Behind this well-organised takeover lies a history of military corruption.

results.title: Lucky
results.creator_credit: John Goldschmidt and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
A boy of 18 re-enacts the way he left his home in Devon and went to London, without money but with high hopes. There he keeps alive cadging and stealing. He takes drugs and is eventually taken to hospital after collapsing on the street. Following this, he is put in touch with the Department of Social Security who help in his rehabilitation.

results.title: Living dangerously
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Reports on the explosion of a chemical factory in Seveso, Italy and the effects of the extremely toxic dust, dioxin, that was released into the atmosphere. The substance dioxin is contained in commercial weedkillers freely available in the United Kingdom.
